00036 FileTokenizer::FileTokenizer( std::FILE* file_ptr )
00037   : filePtr( file_ptr ),
00038     nextToken( buffer ),
00039     bufferEnd( buffer ),
00040     lineNumber( 1 ),
00041     lastChar( '\0' )
00042   {}
00043   
00044 FileTokenizer::~FileTokenizer() 
00045   { fclose( filePtr ); }
00046 
00047 bool FileTokenizer::eof() const
00048   { return nextToken == bufferEnd && feof(filePtr); }
00049 
00050 const char* FileTokenizer::get_string( MsqError& err )
00051 {
00052     // If the whitepsace character marking the end of the
00053     // last token was a newline, increment the line count.
00054   if (lastChar == '\n')
00055     ++lineNumber;
00056   
00057     // Loop until either found the start of a token to return or have
00058     // reached the end of the file.
00059   for (;;)
00060   {
00061       // If the buffer is empty, read more.
00062     if (nextToken == bufferEnd)
00063     {
00064       size_t count = fread( buffer, 1, sizeof(buffer) - 1, filePtr );
00065       if (!count)
00066       {
00067         if (feof(filePtr))
00068           MSQ_SETERR(err)( "File truncated.\n", MsqError::PARSE_ERROR );
00069         else
00070           MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::IO_ERROR );
00071         return NULL;
00072       }
00073       
00074       nextToken = buffer;
00075       bufferEnd = buffer + count;
00076     }
00077     
00078       // If the current character is not a space, we've found a token.
00079     if (!isspace(*nextToken))
00080       break;
00081       
00082       // If the current space character is a newline,
00083       // increment the line number count.
00084     if (*nextToken == '\n')
00085       ++lineNumber;
00086     ++nextToken;
00087   }
00088   
00089     // Store the start of the token in "result" and
00090     // advance "nextToken" to one past the end of the
00091     // token.
00092   char* result = nextToken;
00093   while (nextToken != bufferEnd && !isspace(*nextToken))
00094     ++nextToken;
00095   
00096     // If we have reached the end of the buffer without finding
00097     // a whitespace character terminating the token, we need to
00098     // read more from the file.  Only try once.  If the token is
00099     // too large to fit in the buffer, give up.
00100   if (nextToken == bufferEnd)
00101   {
00102       // Shift the (possibly) partial token to the start of the buffer.
00103     size_t remaining = bufferEnd - result;
00104     memmove( buffer, result, remaining );
00105     result = buffer;
00106     nextToken =  result + remaining;
00107     
00108       // Fill the remainder of the buffer after the token.
00109     size_t count = fread( nextToken, 1, sizeof(buffer) - remaining - 1, filePtr );
00110     if (!count && !feof(filePtr))
00111     {
00112       MSQ_SETERR(err)( "I/O error.\n", MsqError::IO_ERROR );
00113       return NULL;
00114     }
00115     bufferEnd = nextToken + count;
00116     
00117       // Continue to advance nextToken until we find the space
00118       // terminating the token.
00119     while (nextToken != bufferEnd && !isspace(*nextToken))
00120       ++nextToken;
00121   
00122     if (nextToken == bufferEnd) // EOF
00123     {
00124       *bufferEnd = '\0';
00125       ++bufferEnd;
00126     }
00127   }
00128   
00129     // Save terminating whitespace character (or NULL char if EOF).
00130   lastChar = *nextToken;
00131     // Put null in buffer to mark end of current token.
00132   *nextToken = '\0';
00133     // Advance nextToken to the next character to search next time.
00134   ++nextToken;
00135   return result;
00136 }

00138 bool FileTokenizer::get_double_internal( double& result, MsqError& err )
00139 {
00140     // Get a token
00141   const char *token_end, *token = get_string( err );
00142   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00143     return false;
00144   
00145     // Check for hex value -- on some platforms (e.g. Linux), strtod
00146     // will accept hex values, on others (e.g. Sun) it wil not.  Force
00147     // failure on hex numbers for consistancy.
00148   if (token[0] && token[1] && token[0] == '0' && toupper(token[1]) == 'X')
00149   {
00150     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
00151       "Syntax error at line %d: expected number, got \"%s\"",
00152       line_number(), token );
00153     return false;
00154   }
00155   
00156   
00157     // Parse token as double
00158   result = strtod( token, (char**)&token_end );
00159 
00160     // If the one past the last char read by strtod is
00161     // not the NULL character terminating the string,
00162     // then parse failed.
00163   if (*token_end)
00164   {
00165     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
00166       "Syntax error at line %d: expected number, got \"%s\"",
00167       line_number(), token );
00168     return false;
00169   }
00170   
00171   return true;
00172 }
00173 
00174 bool FileTokenizer::get_float_internal( float& result, MsqError& err )
00175 {
00176   double d;
00177   get_double_internal( d, err );
00178   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00179     return false;
00180   
00181   result = (float)d;
00182   if (d != (double)result)
00183   {
00184     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR, "Numberic overflow at line %d.", line_number() );
00185     return false;
00186   }
00187   
00188   return true;
00189 }
00190 
00191 bool FileTokenizer::get_long_int_internal( long& result, MsqError& err )
00192 {
00193     // Get a token
00194   const char *token_end, *token = get_string( err );
00195   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00196     return false;
00197   
00198     // Parse token as long
00199   result = strtol( token, (char**)&token_end, 0 );
00200 
00201     // If the one past the last char read by strtol is
00202     // not the NULL character terminating the string,
00203     // then parse failed.
00204   if (*token_end)
00205   {
00206     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
00207       "Syntax error at line %d: expected integer, got \"%s\"",
00208       line_number(), token );
00209     return false;
00210   }
00211 
00212   return true;
00213 }

00215 bool FileTokenizer::get_byte_internal( unsigned char& result, MsqError& err )
00216 {
00217   long i;
00218   get_long_int_internal( i, err );
00219   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00220     return false;
00221   
00222   result = (unsigned char)i;
00223   if (i != (long)result)
00224   {
00225     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR, "Numberic overflow at line %d.", line_number() );
00226     return false;
00227   }
00228   
00229   return true;
00230 }

00257   if (i != (long)result)
00258   {
00259     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR, "Numberic overflow at line %d.", line_number() );
00260     return false;

00265 
00266 bool FileTokenizer::get_boolean_internal( bool& result, MsqError& err )
00267 {
00268     // Get a token
00269   const char *token = get_string( err );
00270   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00271     return false;
00272   
00273   if (token[1] || (token[0] != '0' && token[0] != '1'))
00274   {
00275     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
00276       "Syntax error at line %d: expected 0 or 1, got \"%s\"",
00277       line_number(), token );
00278     return false;
00279   }
00280 
00281   result = token[0] == '1';
00282   return true;
00283 }

00285 bool FileTokenizer::get_floats( size_t count, float* array, MsqError& err )
00286 {
00287   for (size_t i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00288   {
00289     if (!get_float_internal( *array, err ))
00290       return false;
00291     ++array;
00292   }
00293   return true;
00294 }

00368 
00369 void FileTokenizer::unget_token()
00370 {
00371   if (nextToken - buffer < 2)
00372     return;
00373   
00374   --nextToken;
00375   *nextToken = lastChar;
00376   --nextToken;
00377   while (nextToken > buffer && *nextToken)
00378     --nextToken;
00379     
00380   if (!*nextToken)
00381     ++nextToken;
00382     
00383   lastChar = '\0';
00384 }
00385 
00386 bool FileTokenizer::match_token( const char* str, MsqError& err )
00387 {
00388     // Get a token
00389   const char *token = get_string( err );
00390   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00391     return false;
00392 
00393     // Check if it matches
00394   if (0 == strcmp( token, str ))
00395     return true;
00396   
00397     // Construct error message
00398   MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR,
00399     "Syntax error at line %d: expected \"%s\", got \"%s\"",
00400     line_number(), str, token );
00401   return false;
00402 }  // namespace Mesquite
00403 
00404 
00405 int FileTokenizer::match_token( const char* const* list, MsqError& err )
00406 {
00407     // Get a token
00408   const char *token = get_string( err );
00409   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00410     return false;
00411 
00412     // Check if it matches any input string
00413   const char* const* ptr;
00414   for (ptr = list; *ptr; ++ptr)
00415     if (0 == strcmp( token, *ptr ))
00416       return ptr - list + 1;
00417   
00418     // No match, constuct error message
00419   std::string message( "Parsing error at line " );
00420   char lineno[16];
00421   sprintf( lineno, "%d", line_number() );
00422   message += lineno;
00423   message += ": expected one of {";
00424   for (ptr = list; *ptr; ++ptr)
00425   {
00426     message += " ";
00427     message += *ptr;
00428   }
00429   message += " } got \"";
00430   message += token;
00431   message += "\"";
00432   MSQ_SETERR(err)( message, MsqError::PARSE_ERROR );
00433   return false;
00434 }
00435 
00436 bool FileTokenizer::get_newline( MsqError& err )
00437 {
00438   if (lastChar == '\n')
00439   {
00440     lastChar = ' ';
00441     ++lineNumber;
00442     return true;
00443   }
00444   
00445     // Loop until either we a) find a newline, b) find a non-whitespace
00446     // character or c) reach the end of the file.
00447   for (;;)
00448   {
00449       // If the buffer is empty, read more.
00450     if (nextToken == bufferEnd)
00451     {
00452       size_t count = fread( buffer, 1, sizeof(buffer), filePtr );
00453       if (!count)
00454       {
00455         if (eof())
00456           MSQ_SETERR(err)( "File truncated.", MsqError::PARSE_ERROR );
00457         else
00458           MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::IO_ERROR );
00459         return false;
00460       }
00461       
00462       nextToken = buffer;
00463       bufferEnd = buffer + count;
00464     }
00465     
00466       // If the current character is not a space, the we've failed.
00467     if (!isspace(*nextToken))
00468     {
00469       MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::PARSE_ERROR, "Expected newline at line %d.", line_number() );
00470       return false;
00471     }
00472       
00473       // If the current space character is a newline,
00474       // increment the line number count.
00475     if (*nextToken == '\n')
00476     {
00477       ++lineNumber;
00478       ++nextToken;
00479       lastChar = ' ';
00480       return true;
00481     }
00482     ++nextToken;
00483   }
00484   
00485     // should never reach this
00486   return false;
00487 }
